text.p: Lithuanian tractor parts producer Kuro Aparatura said on Thursday that it suffered 184,000 litas losses in the first five months of the year.
Finance director Dalia Zhilinskaite told Reuters that in May the company made a 391,000 litas loss as clients had paid in goods and these goods were sold at a loss.
The company is also suffering from the fact that consumers fail to pay their debts on time. Debt amounted to around 50 million litas at the end of May, she added.
The company exports 90 percent of its products, mainly to CIS countries.
Zhilinskaite also said that sales fell in the first five months of the year to 29.74 million litas from 51.8 million litas in the same period in 1996.
